name: Avoid hardcoded network resource names
description:
This quality rule reports all artifacts that contain hardcoded: 

- URLs (of the form file:///c:/Tmp/Folder/ or http://host.com/folder) 
- Paths (Windows absolute paths of the form c:\Tmp\Folder) 
- JDBC URL (of the form jdbc:oracle:thin:@//myhost:1521/orcl) 
- IP addresses (IPv4 format like 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255) 
- JNDI lookup path 

Note: This quality rule implements the rule ASCRM-RLB-18 of the CISQ standard.
output:
List all artifacts that reference hard coded IP adresses, URL, paths
It provides the following information: 
 - Artifact full name
rationale: Built-in remote addresses cause problems when the target is moved. Avoid of hardcoded network resources (e.g., IP addresses, URLs, etc.)
reference: ASCRM 1.0, Automated Source Code Reliability Measure, Object Management Group.

qualityStandards.name: Hard-coded network resource information
qualityStandards.description: Remove instances where a variable, field, member, etc. is initialized with a hard-coded network resource identification information
